result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher M. Beatty

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:00 AM/ RM 203. Defendant Kristopher M. Beatty appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. Case was to be called on 10/24, but was rescheduled for today as Court was overbooked. Court notes appointment of counsel report. Def. continues to wish for counsel. Def. has waived time limits for P.H. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on November 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

for Bond Reduction 
Routed to Judge's JA

2:55 PM/ RM 301. Defendant Kristopher M. Beatty appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Court reviews case history and appointment of counsel report. Def. continues to ask for counsel. Court advises Def. of right to have P.H. within time limits and questions if Def. would like to waive time limits. Def. waives time limits on P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits and agrees Def. needs counsel. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:01 PM/Room 301. Defendant Kristopher M. Beatty appeared by video, in custody at the Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin by Zoom.  All appearances are by Zoom. Def. makes argument for bond modification, requests $50,000 signature bond. State objects to modification, gives reasoning. Response by Def. Remarks by the Court. Court denies motion, advises Def. that he may file a written motion if he wants to revisit issue. Def. asks for lower cash bond. Response by Court. Court confirms that motion is denied. Further proceedings already scheduled.
Bail/bond hearing on October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:01 PM Defendant Kristopher M. Beatty appeared by video, in custody from Langlade County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Court notes bond modification request and has been routed to Judge's JA.  Def. is eligible for P.D. and wants to wait. Court finds good cause to go past the time limits. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

for bond reduction
Routed to Judge's JA

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

1:12 PM Defendant Kristopher M. Beatty appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. wants atty.  Court directs Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. No victim rights. State gives bail/bond recommendation with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Defendant makes statement regarding bond. Court gives factors of setting bond.  Def. mutes defendant. Court orders $10,000  cash bond as def. left video room with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
